name: La Residence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, the decor the attentive staff, the wonderful food. Just cant say enough about what a great experience this was. We had the Blue Room and it was amazing! Our view of the pond with various birds coming and going was very special. We also spent a few hours at Le Petite Ferme and John's tour of his winery was quite special indeed. Hope to return to this part of the world one day.
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd read all the reviews and all I can say is our expectations were EXCEEDED by La Residence and the amazing staff. We had room #3, which was an outside corner room that was simply beautiful--I will try to add photos later---but it's even better than it looks on line. The grounds are extraordinary, the main hall is amazing and the staff really made it even better. Not only did they anticipate our every need---but they went above and beyond in every aspect. We loved that they drove us into to town for dinner and picked us up--our room seems like it was cleaned constantly--laundry done regularly----wow. This is by far one of the nicest places we've ever stayed and I would NOT hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: As fabulous as everyone says!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Attention to detail in the interior design, service and friendly atmosphere is amongst the best we have experienced. Food was exceptional and altogether provided a truly memorable experience.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: We would endorse every word of the other reviews. We have stayed in hotels all over the world and this tops them all. I could not believe that any hotel (that seems the wrong word) could be faultless, as the rankings on here suggested, but it is. Well done to the owners and the fantastic staff team - an amazing achievement. We will be back.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with everything that has been written about La Residence. 5 stars are not enough to describe it - it is in a category all of its own!
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in . Our room was very spacious and comfortable, the location is very peaceful in a vineyard and the service is very friendly and professional. This place is truly deserving of all the great reviews it has received.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only stayed one night, wish our whole vacation could have been here. Hotel is on par with the best of the best. Everything about the place is perfect, the setting, public spaces and room were excellent. Service was great and the food was the best we had in South Africa. Hotel is a a gem.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 4 days stay at La Residence and cant rave enough about it! In one sense i want to tell everyone so they can share in the experience, but in another slightly selfish way, I dont want too many people to go so as to ruin it!! The hotel is situated in a fabulous location so that all the bedrooms (11 in main building) get excellent views. Upon arrival we were greeted by the GM with a glass of champagne and a friendly tour of the property. We were then shown to our very beautiful room, The Maharani Suite. It is very lavish with lots of interesting pieces of furniture and art and an amazing bed in the middle with views over the beautiful vineyard and over the lake. The bathroom was huge and beautifully done too. I have to say, all the suites are amazing, but the superior suites are bigger and ours had one of the best views!! There is almost nothing they wont do for you here, they even came to unpack our cases ( i unpacked my own, but when doing my husbands, they ever RE FOLDED my garments which were already in the wardrobe!!) In the room is a decanter of brandy for you to indulge in, and there was champagne on ice for our arrival. On top of this, there was a snack cupboard with all complimentary treats, jelly beans , crisps, chocolate etc and in the mini bar soft drinks and miniature spirits all comp ! We have stayed at other lovely hotels ( mainly The Four Seasons level of hotel) and have never had anything thrown in! Also, by the pool, all soft drinks are free and they will also do your laundry complimentary. All of these little touches are very much appreciated as was the complimentary car service into the village of Franshoek. The food is amazing and if there is something that you fancy other than what is on the lunch menu, they are happy to oblige. And it is served up so prettily with lavender decoration, fresh from the herb garden. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and nothing is too much. The GM , Edward, is a very hands on kind of guy, very friendly and is always around for a little chat. I could go on and on, but you get the drift, Amazing, fantastic, stunning, we will be back!!
reviews.title: Amazing , Fantastic , Stunning !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at this fantastic property and everything was perfect! The rooms were the most lavish and creatively decorated that I have ever stayed in. We had the opportunity to tour the new villas and they are as wonderful as the rooms in the main hotel. The staff was excellent as was the food and hospitality of the manager. If you are South Africa don't pass up the opportunity to stay at this unique property.
reviews.title: Unbelievable rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: We are just about to leave the Residence to continue our trip. From the moment we arrived the experience has been fantastic. I would have liked to put a score of 10 out of 5 for the service. Allen, Xandra, Nick, Evan.... Eduardo, all were amazing. British Airways did all they could to spoil our Xmas, but the team at the Residence did everything they could to get our luggage here safe and sound.
reviews.title: Any better would be a sin!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not your typical review as it’s difficult to define La Residence in terms of hotel standards by the mere fact that it blows them all away. Therefore, I will spare you all the details regarding room cleanliness, value for money, etc and rather see how many superlatives I can cram into this review. La Residence is positioned in one of the most idyllic places on earth with uninterrupted views of the mountains and winelands. Smells of lavender and flowers surround the premises. The interior decorating is beyond imagination with every detail meticulously crafted to the point that you could spend days just admiring the variety of decor and artwork at this “hotel”. However, the crowning achievement for La Residence is the way you are made to feel during your stay. The personnel were amazing in that they managed to provide the feeling of complete privacy whilst still attending to our every whim before the thought had even occurred. The only way I can describe this is by likening it to a very warm family event. I really could go on about how amazing La Residence and its staff are but I will try sum up my feelings about this place. This was the destination I decided to propose to my fiancé and can say without hesitation or doubt that it was the best experience of my life. The staff of La Residence went above and beyond and made us feel truly special and welcome. Nothing was too big of a request, and everything was handled in the most eloquent of ways. I am truly grateful to La Residence and its staff, and can honestly say that is very difficult to put a value on the experience they are able to create for you. Whether you are deciding to propose or just looking for a break...La Residence is something special that needs to be experienced.
reviews.title: Sublime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The South African Garden Route and Winelands are not short of choice when it comes to fine boutique hotels, some of which are genuinely excellent.
reviews.title: Sheer Excellence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Residence is the best.
reviews.title: Our Favourite Hotel Experience Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: First sight of the uninspired exterior architecture might not fill you with confidence but don't panic. The money that seems to have been saved on the construction has been put to masterful use everywhere else. The decor which, given its complexity and richness, could have been hopelessly over-the-top, is simply gloriously comfortable. The service is charming and efficient. The bedrooms and wonderful bathrooms are as good as any I have encountered anywhere. The views are classic wineland.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read about a new property near Stellenbosch that had been built regardless of cost by a well know Englishman and went on there for a couple of days after leaving La Residence. The international interiors would not have offended anyone. The service was professional. It wasn't in the same league as La Residence, lacking the heart and soul that mere professionalism can't match.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: This review will probably be my most difficult one to write because I simply cannot come up with enough superlatives to describe what a world-class resort this is. Whilst there, we felt like we had been transported to another time and place. Every single thing about this place is incredible and will leave you speechless.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, you are greeted by security who calls ahead to inform the hotel of your arrival. As you pull up to the entrance, you are greeted by Edward and some members of his team. Normally, this type of attention would make me feel a bit too fussed over, but for some reason, they just know how to make this level of attention work and seem natural. It truly felt like you were being greeted by a trusted friend who had welcomed you to their vacation home.
reviews.title: The World's best hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Edward took us to our rooms (my mother was in the Tang Suite, and I was in the Maharani Suite) and gave us a brief tour of the grounds. Bottom-line, the place is exquisite. Every detail has been attended to, and not a single thing can be found out of place. I credit Edward for the great job he has done organizing everything there. We also happened to be fortunate enough to have arrived at the same time the owner, Liz Biden, was there with some friends. Edward introduced us, and she was perfectly lovely. You can really see her passion in the design of La Residence, and it was a great experience being able to meet her! She even stopped by as we were having dinner later to say hello and see how everything was. I thought that was a pretty extraordinary gesture on her part.
reviews.title: Perhaps the best hotel room ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could wax poetic about the plush grounds for days. You really feel as though you are in some fantasy-land, from the palm trees, to the majestic hills and mountain range in the background, all set to the music of the swans swimming in the adjoining lake. I can understand now why people choose to celebrate special occasions here because I certainly could not imagine a more romantic or beautiful spot.
reviews.title: Exceptional - truly memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the interior of the hotel, this place is certainly not for minimalist design enthusiasts! You are surrounded by gold, crystal, lush fabrics, gorgeous artwork and various pieces of furniture. It sounds like a visual overload, but it all works and manages to be opulent yet tasteful. Despite the decidedly high-brow design scheme, you will truly feel at home here. I credit Liz, Edward and the rest of the team at La Residence for this because everyone is simply a treasure. Every need is anticipated. Each preference is noted and taken to heart. They knew me better than I know me! I loved the fact that there are so many varied lounging areas in the main building because each area is like a separate vignette with its own mood. When the sun was shining, the loungers by the pool or the lounge area facing the lake were fantastic. When it rained, being able to retreat in front of the fireplace was warming and relaxing.
reviews.title: Definitely ticks all the boxes - stunning!

description: La Residence is in a class of its own. Located in the beautiful Franschhoek valley, where the exquisite vineyards and mountains form a picture perfect backdrop, La Residence provides a haven of luxurious accommodation, fine dining and an all-round sensory indulgence.
